comment:
Copper, thick legs. Cherry, lemon. Mildly sweet, caramel, cream. Medium body, mild burn.
Pleasant, unexceptional.

While the well-versed may turn up their nose at this for being overpriced mystery whiskey and the uninitiated may fall head over heals for "20yo" I find myself somewhere in between. The bottle is gorgeous, the taste--on my dense palate--is delicious, full, and woody, the price is...well, we won't talk about that.  This is a great bourbon. I went to three different states before I found it and am quite pleased. Don't buy it for its age statement, don't discount it for its  sales pitch, enjoy it for what it is--and buy it because the bottle is pretty.

Edit: If you think the proof is too low or that it's over filtered, vat a 1:1 with Stagg Jr. Batch 3 or 4 and thank me later.
20 a pour... Fucking smooth sweetness. Bite hung back.
Have enjoyed 2 bottles and have one put away. Think I like the barter house better
Very butterscotch. Since I'm a sucker for butterscotch, I love this bourbon. Velvety and warming.
Lots of oak and leather on the nose. You get your classic bourbon flavors, but it finishes a little short. A fairly good pour, but the value is not there.
21 year version just released and supposedly even better!
Just purchased the 21 year in Chicago $89.00. Waiting to try it.
A bit of high heat, like a 90 mph fastball. Definitely some zip.

Should have been released at Barrel Proof. Nothing hot about this bourbon. It's smooth like candy and oaky like you are sucking on staves.  I happen to like heavily oaked bourbons so this suits me, with exception to the low proof.
Not what I had hoped. But I just picked up the 21 year as well. Waiting to open it... But can't find it on Distiller. Has anyone tried it yet?
you prefer a softer, sweeter style of bourbon, Barterhouse is for you. If you like things a bit more rugged and spicy, buy Rhetoric.
I actually have the older 21 year old rhetoric not this one...
Purchased in New Albany, In for $136. looking forward to tasting it.
Good, but too strong and too expensive for me
Very smooth. Slight tinge on the tip of the tongue, but very well balanced and fantastic.
